title: General
custom_preconds:
English
MLB - http://mlb.mlb.com/mobile/data/highlights/atbat.xml
Team - http://mlb.mlb.com/gen/multimedia/videolist/search/hou.xml

Spanish
MLB - http://mlb.mlb.com/mobile/data/highlights/es/atbat.xml
Team - http://mlb.mlb.com/gen/multimedia/videolist/search/es/tor.xml

**for the QA endpoint just swap out the first MLB for QA n the URL

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"shouldKillVideoSharing":true
"shouldKillVideoSharing":false

iphoneConfig.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the News tab at the bottom and taps on the Videos segment
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB Video index will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Video tab and scrolls down the videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be limited to a maximum of the most recent 30 videos

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user scrolls through the video section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will briefly see a placeholder icon for each video before the video's thumbnail loads

**May need to throttle connection using Charles Proxy

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Videos segment
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have access to the Search box and Team Selector filter

custom_steps_separated.content: When we are on the MLB or team specific videos and we search for highlights
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the search results are correct and accurate and pertinent to the team selected

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user examines the contents of a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the thumbnail will contain a title in white bolded font
and the time/date stamp will be below the the title
and will contain an info button in the top right corner
and a share button on the bottom right corner
and all text present will be clear and legible

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user pulls down the section below the Top Stories/Videos segmented controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then iOS pull to refresh will be exposed with circle animation (similar to native iOS Mail App) and the videos section will refresh with the most current video in the index at top

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then video will play inline and the video controller will have a overlay with the following:

Top Overlay: X button Title, AirPlay, Chromecast, Share
Bottom Overlay: Play/Pause, Elapsed (M:SS), Scrubber, Remaining (M:SS), Toggle Full Screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a highlight video thumbnail and taps on Toggle Full Screen button on the bottom overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will play in Full screen mode

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode in landscape mode and taps on the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video controller UI will appear onscreen with the following:

Top Overlay: X button, Title, AirPlay, Chromecast, Share
Bottom Overlay: Play/Pause, Elapsed (M:SS), Scrubber, Remaining (M:SS), Toggle Full Screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode in portrait mode and taps on the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video controller UI will appear onscreen with the following:

Top Overlay: X button, Title, AirPlay, Chromecast, Share
Bottom Overlay: Play/Pause, Elapsed (M:SS), Scrubber, Remaining (M:SS), Toggle Full Screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is connected to the same network as a Chromecast and then plays a video then taps the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a Chromecast icon on the top overlay of the video controller

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is connected to the same network as an Apple TV and then plays a video and taps the screen

disableAirplay is set to false in iPhone and iPad config
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a user will see an Apple TV icon on the top overlay of the video controller

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is playing a inline video and then holds down the dot on the scrubber
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will stop
and the Play button will turn to a Pause button
and the user is able to move the scrubber back and forward

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is playing an inline video and then moves the scrubber dot to advance the video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will stop and then start again at the point where the video was scrubbed

Test moving the scrubber back and forth

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is playing a video in fullscreen and then holds down the dot on the scrubber
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will stop
and the Play button will turn to a Pause button
and the user is able to move the scrubber back and forward

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is playing an video in full screen and moves the scrubber dot to advance the video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will stop and then start again and the point where the video was scrubbed

custom_steps_separated.content: On WIFI connection, when a user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video playback for the selected highlight will begin

custom_steps_separated.content: On Carrier connection, when a user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video playback for the selected highlight will begin

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays an inline video and scrolls the video index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video continues to play inline 
and can be viewed when scrolling back to that highlight

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video and turns the iPhone landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will play in Full screen mode

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode and the video finishes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the video interstitial in between videos
and X button in the upper left
and Play Again button
and Play Next Video button
and Next video will begin <number> text
and next highlight will automatically start

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and taps on the X button in the upper left
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the interstitial will close
and the user is returned to the Video index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and taps on the Play Again button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the interstitial will close
and previous video will play again

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and taps on the Play Next Video button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the interstitial will close
and next video will play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a video in full screen
and the user is at the video interstitial between videos
and user observes the Next video will begin <number> text
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see <number> count down
and then interstitial will close
and the video will play

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode and taps on the Done button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will stop and the user will be brought back to the video list

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode and the video finishes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the next highlight will begin to play automatically (Lite users may see preroll)
and will continue until the end of that particular index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When pre-roll ad is targeted and a user taps on a video on demand

On PROD it is targeting for Lite User only
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pre-roll video will play followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content:
When pre-roll ad is targeted and a Lite user taps on a video on demand

On PROD it is targeting for Lite User only
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pre-roll video will play followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content:
When pre-roll ad is targeted and a Paid user taps on a video on demand

On PROD it is targeting for Lite User only
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will play for the user without the 30 second pre-roll video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When pre-roll ad is targeted and a user taps on a video on demand on a device with a carrier connection (Verizon, AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile)

On PROD it is targeting for Lite User only
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pre-roll video will play followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content:
When pre-roll ad is targeted and a user taps on a video on demand on a device with a WIFI connection

On PROD it is targeting for Lite User only
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pre-roll video will play followed by the video that is requested

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched a video highlight 
and it is playing in full-screen mode
and the user swipes down

(check for both Lite & Paid users)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video highlight should close and stop playing
and the user should be left on the screen in which they launched the video from

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched a video highlight 
and it is playing in full-screen mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should still see the X at the top left corner
and tapping it should still close the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched a video highlight that is playing in-line
and tries to swipe down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video highlight should not dismiss 
and it should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched and MLB.TV feed
and tries to swipe down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV feed should not dismiss
and it should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content: When the value <keyword type="mmtax" value="shareable"/> (i.e. <keyword type="mmtax">shareable</keyword>) is present for a specific highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video highlight share icon will be visible on the highlight

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the value <keyword type="mmtax" value="shareable"/> (i.e. <keyword type="mmtax">shareable</keyword>) is not present for a specific highlight

(Save a local copy of one of the files above then local map to it and remove the value)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video highlight share icon will not be visible on the highlight

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an admin has turned on the sharing kill switch and a user plays an inline video and taps the screen

"shouldKillVideoSharing": true
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not be able to share the video

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into Twitter and taps on the Share button on the video controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the pop up bubble will appear but the user will not see the Twitter icon as an option to choose

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is logged into Twitter and taps on the Share button on the video controller and Tweet button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Tweet screen will appear onscreen

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Share button on the video controller and taps on Tweet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the tweet sheet should appear
and the format should display the title of the video followed by Sent with MLB.com At Bat
and the last line should be the actual link to the video, but it will only appear on the actual tweet, not the tweet sheet

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into Facebook and taps on the Share button on the video highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the Facebook icon in the pop up bubble

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is logged into Facebook and taps on the Share button on the video controller and then taps on the Facebook button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Post to Wall page will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the share button on the video controller and then taps on Post to Facebook
custom_steps_separated.expected:
When the user Then the Facebok Post to Wall page will appear
and the actual post will display the video thumbnail
and caption followed by www.mlb.com
and will state it's via MLB.com

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has an e-mail account setup on a phone and taps on a Share button on the video controller and then e-mail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then device's native email client will open an email form

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Share button on a video controller and then e-mail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the e-mail draft will appear
and be formatted with the video highlight title, the date & Sent with MLB At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is playing a video and taps on the Share button on the video player
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a New Message screen will appear and once the message is sent it will be formatted with just a video link that will push on the MLB Video site

"shouldKillVideoSharing":true

ipadConfig.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Video tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Video page will open and videos will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a scrolls though the MLB videos for the first time
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will briefly see a placeholder icon for each video before it's thumbnail loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the MLB tab and types in the Search field
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results returned are correct and accurate

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user searches for a video on the team video page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results returned are correct and accurate and pertinent to the team

custom_steps_separated.content: When a lite user is on the Videos page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Team Selector functionality will be available
and the Search functionality will be available

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is on the Videos page and scrolls through the videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results will be limited to a maximum of the most recent 30 videos

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is examining the video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the thumbnail will be present with the following:
* info button on the bottom left
* Share button (when applicable) on the bottom right
* Blurb
* Duration | Month, DD, YYYY

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a video highlight thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video playback for the selected highlight will begin

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will load up and play successfully.

custom_steps_separated.content: On a WIFI connection, when a user taps on a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will load up and play successfully.

Then the video controller UI will appear onscreen with the following:

Top overlay: X button, Title, Volume Slider, AirPlay, Chromecast, Share

Then the user will see the video interstitial in between videos
and X button in the upper left
and Play Again button
and Play Next Video button

and it is playing in full-screen mode
and the user swipes down

custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video highlight should close and stop playing
and the user should be left on the screen in which they launched the video from

When the user has launched a video highlight 
and it is playing in full-screen mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should still see the X at the top left corner
and tapping it should still close the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched and MLB.TV feed
and tries to swipe down
custom_steps_separated.expected:

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a video and it begins to play and taps on the Share button on the video player
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will continue to play and the the user is prompted with share methods

Please test each Share method

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video and and taps on the Share button on the video controller
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will pause and an iOS Share Sheet will appear with Share options

check which one of these two it does: play/pause

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into Twitter and taps on the Share button on the video controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see a Twitter icon in the pop up bubble

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is logged into Twitter then taps on the Share button on the video controller and then taps on the Tweet button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Tweet sheet will appear onscreen

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Share button on the video controller n and selects Tweet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Twitter Share sheet will appear
and the title of the highlights will be populated
and 'Sent with @MLB At Bat will be populated

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into Facebook and taps on the Share button on the video controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will not see the Facebook icon in the pop up bubble

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is logged into Facebook and taps on the Share button on the video controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Post to Wall share sheet will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Share button and taps on Facebook
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Facebook Post Share sheet will appear
and the title of the highlights will be populated
and the big blurb will be populated
and highlight thumbnail will be populated
and the user can add a message

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has an e-mail account setup on the device and taps on the Share icon on the video controller and then E-mail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then device's native email client will open an email form

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on Share button on a video controller and then taps on E-mail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the email draft will appear
and Video title will be in Subject and Body of e-mail
and link to the video on MLB
and Sent with MLB At Bat will be populated

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged into iMessage and taps on Share button on the video controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the iMessage icon in the pop up bubble

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is logged into Message and tapes on the Share button on the video controller and then iMessage
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a New Message screen will appear
and once the message is sent it will be formatted with just a video link that will push to the MLB site

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the MLB button with a down arrow
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the Team Selector/Filter

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the team selector
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see a Filter modal with a Done button
And then below see a MLB filter
then Favorite Team(s)
then the rest of the teams (and logos) will be listed in their appropriate divisions in alphabetical order

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a team from the Team Selector/Filter
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see the highlights index specific to the team 
and the MLB filter button will be converted to a functioning button with the team's name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user adds or removes a Favorite Team from the more section and then accesses the Team Selector/Filter on the Videos tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the changes made in the More section should be reflected in the Team Selector/Filter for Favorite Teams

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Teams > segment on the Videos page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Team Selector will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a team from the Teams > segment on the Videos page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a highlights index specific to the team will open
and the Teams > segment will be converted to a functioning button with the Team's Name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a Favorite team set and taps on Teams tab of the Videos page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Favorite Teams will be listed at the top 
And then teams will be listed in their appropriate divisions in alphabetical order by city

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user searches for a video on the team video page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the results returned are correct and accurate and pertinent to the team

title: Classic Games
custom_preconds: Access Classic Games from tapping on the MLB.TV button then Classics segment on both iPhone and iPad

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user examines the contents of a video thumbnail for a classic game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the thumbnail will contain a title in white bolded font
and an Information icon will be in the top right-hand corner
and a Share icon will be in the lower right-hand corner (iTunes purchase)
and all text present will be clear and legible

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls up and down the Classic games page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scrolling in either direction will be possible
and the scrolling will be smooth

custom_steps_separated.content: On an iPad, when the user taps on the navigation filter button on the top right corner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Classic Game filtering menu will open
and will contain All Games option
and will contain Playoffs option
and will contain World Series option
and will contain Walk-Offs option
and will contain Great Pitching option
and will contain Milestones & Record-Breakers option
and will contain Unforgettables option
and the current running filter will be highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: On an iPad, when a user is on the Classic Games tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a search field will not be available

custom_steps_separated.content: On an iPhone, when the user is on the Classic Games tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Game Type filter will be available in the top right corner

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user selects the Classic Games tab and we press on a thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV Verifying Access window will open
and will check against blackout areas 
and the Classic Game will open

custom_steps_separated.content: When a lite user taps on Classic Game thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the At Bat login/purchase prompt will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a Share button on the thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Buy in iTunes prompt will appear
and this will redirect the user to iTunes if accepted

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the information button on the thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the information for the game will display
and all text present will be clear and legible
and the date that the game occurred will display on the bottom
and tapping information description/thumbnail closes details

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the Classic Games tab and scrolls through the Classic Games list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will briefly see a placeholder icon for each video before it's thumbnail loads

custom_steps_separated.content: When we select the Classic Games tab and examine the thumbnails
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the formatting of the text & thumbnails appears consistent

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a Classic Game
and holds the device in portrait
and taps to display the video controllers
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the controls

<Done> <Title>
<scrubber> <play/pause> <caption>

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user plays a Classic Game
and holds the device in landscape
and taps to display the video controllers
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the controls

<Done> <Title>
<play/pause>  <scrubber> <iPad PiP><caption>

PIP is iPad only

title: MLB Network Authentication
custom_preconds:
TEST CASES SHOULD BE PERFORMED ON BOTH IPHONE AND IPAD

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mm/MLBN+Streaming+2015+-+Functional+Spec

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on More and then MLB Network
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the MLB Network page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on MLB Network page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a back button that will bring the user back to the More section, the header for MLB Network, and a Info button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the MLB Network page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see section under the MLB Network header with the following:
-Text for 'Now on MLB Network' and 'All Times in ET'
-Thumbnail of the show with a Play button over it
-Live button
-Title of the program
-A"Presented by" slug with a brand logo (displayed only when a brand has sponsored a particular MLBN program)
-A text description
-The start time in ET US of the program

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the MLB Network page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see Text for 'Coming Up and Row items for each upcoming show with 
-The title of the program
-A "Presented by" slug with a brand logo (displayed only when a brand has sponsored a particular MLBN program)
-A text description
-The start time in ET US of the program

title: iPad > MLB Network > 24 Hour Time

Given a user is on an iOS device

custom_expected:

and no errors

title: General
custom_preconds:
Data source for main video index is - http://mlb.mlb.com/mobile/data/highlights/atbat.xml 
Data source for individual teams and postseason is query based, talk to developer to get correct query string.

custom_steps_separated.content: User opens Video section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User should see a list of 30 videos.

Should be a Drop Down Spinner with all 30 teams and Postseason Videos when turned on. 

Should take user to main MLB Video index by default.

There should be a search button in the right side of the action bar in the Video section
And the Audio/MLB.TV buttons should not appear in the action bar

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify video layout
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Each video should have high resolution thumbnail
Each video should have Title at bottom of cell
Each video should show metadata (MM:SS) - MM/DD/YYYY

Each Video should have Info Button in bottom left of cell if a big blurb is present
Each Video should have share button in bottom right of cell if sharing is enabled for the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify video with no thumbnail in video index
or while user is swiping through video index and thumbnails have yet to load
custom_steps_separated.expected: Cell should appear with placeholder thumbnail

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps in the info button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video title should dim
And the user should see a video description in paragraph form

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on the info button to bring up the video description
And the user then taps anywhere on the same video tile
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video description should disappear 
And the user should be able to launch the video by tapping on the tile.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a big blurb is not present for a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Info button will not appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a video in the video index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video should be launched
And the video should play through to completion without issue
And the user should be able to seek through the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on a video in the video index
(video orientation)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will begin to play in whichever orientation the device was in when the user launched the stream
(if in portrait, then portrait; if in landscape, then landscape)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing a video highlight
And the user rotates the device 90 degrees or 180 degrees
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video orientation should rotate along with the device orientation
And the video should NOT restart/relaunch

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user sends the app to the background while a video is playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: The video should continue playing and minimize in a smaller window with option to expand and close the window.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify that app does not time out while video is playing
(Set screen timeout to time lower than length of video)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Video should continue playing past normal screen off time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects the drop down spinner
And selects a team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video index should be refreshed 
And the user should see videos specific to the team that was selected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has one or more favorite teams set in the app
And the user taps the drop down spinner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then their favorite team(s) will be listed first under a "Teams" category
and this will be located under the "MLB" filter
and above the "Teams" category

title: Sharing
custom_preconds:
User has the Twitter for Android App installed (And valid Twitter testing account)
User has the Facebook for Android App installed (And valid Facebook testing account)
User has a Mail or Gmail account logged in
custom_steps: When the user taps the Share Button on the Video page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Twitter app in the Share menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Compose Tweet screen should appear with the Video URL pre-populated

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Twitter app in the Share menu
And the user composes and posts the tweet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Compose Tweet screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the Video index containing the video they were viewing
And the Tweet should be sent successfully (check on twitter and verify that the link in the tweet takes the user to the correct Video.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user begins to share with Twitter and has launched the Compose Tweet screen
And the user taps the 'Cancel' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is asked if they want to save or discard their draft

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user begins to share with Twitter and has launched the Compose Tweet screen
And the user taps the device's back button twice
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the Video index containing the Video they tried to share.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Facebook app in the Share menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a Facebook Post screen should appear with the Video URL and Metadata pre-populated. (Note: Metadata may not appear with an Video shared from QA.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Facebook app in the Share menu
And the user composes and posts the Video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Facebook Post screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the Video index containing the Video they tried to share. 

And the Post should be sent successfully (check on Facebook and verify that the link in the post takes the user to the correct Video.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user begins to share with Facebook and has launched the Facebook post screen
And the user taps the 'Cancel' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Facebook Post screen should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the Video index containing the Video they tried to share.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Email app or Gmail in the Share menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the subject of the email should be pre-populated with the Video Title
And the URL of the Video should be pre-populated in the message body

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the shares the Video through Email
And sends the email
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Email app should close
And the user should be returned to At Bat and left on the Video index containing the Video they tried to share. 

And the Email should be sent successfully (check on the recipient's end and verify that the link in the email takes the user to the correct Video.)

title: Layout (Handset & 7 inch tablet)
custom_preconds:
Handset & 7 inch tablet

Nexus 7
Kindle Fire HD 7

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the Video Index in portrait
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will see one column of video cells displayed in the order they appear in the data

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the Video Index in Landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see two columns of video cells displayed in the order they appear in the data

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the Video Index in portrait
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see two columns of video cells displayed in the order they appear in the data

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the Video Index in landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see three columns of video cells displayed in the order they appear in the data

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches using the search button on the action bar in the main MLB Video index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
After 2 characters have been typed, results from the Videos Search will load over the Video Index content
and the results header will display below the search: "Search Results (X matches)"
and the Videos returned will display using the same UI/functionality as the Videos index

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user searches using the search button on the action bar in a team index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a video index with search results specific to the team index the user was searching in for the term the user chose.
(eg. If the user searches for 'Jeter' in the Baltimore Orioles team index, the user should only see results from the Orioles index that pertain to Jeter. They should not see all Jeter videos.)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps Close
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Search overlay will be removed and the user will be placed back in the Videos Index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has typed letters into the search bar
and then taps the X
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the typed letters will be erased

custom_steps_separated.content: When the search functionality is being used
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the drop down team index filter will be hidden

title: Timeout Message
custom_steps:
When the user has a less than optimal connection (Wifi or carrier)
and the user taps the Videos tab
and the request is taking a long time to load data
custom_expected:
Then Timeout will be 30 seconds
and on timeout, last available data will be used and the following message will appear:
Message: Low Connectivity: using last available data
Button: OK

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user pulls down on the Video Index screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data will be refreshed and any new data will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has entered a search query and the search results have populated
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should NOT be able to pull to refresh the search result data

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user navigates to the Video Index
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then cache is ignored and fresh data will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user changes the team filter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then cache is ignored and fresh data will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When the app is backgrounded, then foregrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then cache will be used if available

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user expands the side nav and taps on MLB Network
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the MLB Network page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on MLB Network page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a back button that will bring the user back to the previous section, the header for MLB Network, and a Info button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the MLB Network page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see section under the MLB Network header with the following:
-Text for 'Watch Live Now on MLB Network' and 'All Times in ET'
-Thumbnail of the show with a Play button over it
-Title of the program
-A"Presented by" slug with a brand logo (displayed only when a brand has sponsored a particular MLBN program)
-A text description
-The start time in ET US of the program

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the MLB Network page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see Text for 'Coming Up' and Row items for each upcoming show with:
-The title of the program
-A "Presented by" slug with a brand logo (displayed only when a brand has sponsored a particular MLBN program)
-A text description
-The start time in ET US of the program

custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user is presented with the cable auth web flow:
- "pull down" pick list of cable providers
- user is presented with a username and password form

custom_steps_separated.content: When a lite user is logged into At Bat and taps the MLB Network play button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user is presented with the cable auth web flow:
- "pull down" pick list of cable providers
- user is presented with a username and password form

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user logs in to the cable auth web flow successfully
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an entitlement to the network will be granted and the stream will be launched

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user logs in to the cable auth web flow unsuccessfully
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not be able granted access to the network and be directed to MVPD's customer service

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is viewing the MLB Network content in At Bat and the content goes to commercial break
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user will see MLBN-branded slate into the video, in place of the commercial breaks

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user sets their device to 24 hour time (General > Date & Time) and the users access MLB Network in At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB Network page with current show and schedule will load

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is playing an MLB Network feed
and taps to display the video controls
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a Stop button  the following:

Portrait: Closed Caption button, PiP button (if applicable)
Landscape: Volume slide, Mute button, Closed Caption button, PiP button (if applicable)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is playing an MLB Network feed
and uses any of the video control buttons (Closed Caption, volume, mute, PiP)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will all function as expected

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is playing an MLB Network feed
and taps the stop button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stream will stop and the user will be taken back to the MLB Network page
